aligned: Imagine that {all the=>} people have masks on their {mouthes=>mouths} and noses like we have {sun-glasses=>sunglasses} , and that all the masks are designers brands , which are made of special {material=>materials} to prevent us from breathing in polluted air .

aligned: At the same time , the enforceability of the ODP license is overshadowed by the {the=>} fact that users of ODP data {=>,} who do not adhere to the terms of the license {=>,} generate a great deal of ill will among the community of volunteer ODP editors .

aligned: Also , it is worth {mentionable=>mentioning} that the hundreds of castes who did {so=>} menial and dirty labor {that they=>} were kept out of the four-varna system , thus becoming the so-called " untouchables " ( {=>in} modern India , {being=>} known as " Dalits " , lit. , the oppressed , and in the Indian Constitution as the " Scheduled Castes " or SCs ) .

Especially that=>, especially since} it is so hard to find anything in {a=>} modern , huge {and=>department stores} stuffed with lots of merchandise {department stores=>} .

aligned: One of the most interesting ones is {=>,} " The {old man=>Old Man} and the Sea {=>.} " {. A=>It 's the} story of an old seaman leaving his town to {proove=>prove} that he is still able to catch the biggest fish ever caught .

aligned: But the Peruvian government {take=>took} new measures to recover {the=>} control of the {sea ,=>sea,} and {in=>on} May 21 {sign=>signed} an accord with the representatives of Great Britain and France to allow their ships to protect {the=>} guano production and their {economical=>economic} interests {,=>;} at the same time {the president=>, President} Castilla {offer=>offered} an unconditional {forgive=>pardon} to the rebel sailors .

- The comma was replaced with a semicolon because two independent clauses, without a coordinating conjunction, are combined with a semicolon.
- A comma after the introductory phrase "at the same time" was added to separate the introductory prepositional phrase from the main clause.
- the title "President" was capitalized because it occurs before the person's name.
- The verb tense is changed from present tense "offer" to past tense "offered" because the sentences describe events that took place in the past.

- "The" is removed before "control of the sea" to improve sentence structure.
- "In" is changed to "on" to accurately reflect the date the accord was signed.
- "Sign" is changed to "signed" to correct the tense of the verb.
- "The" is removed before "guano production" to improve sentence structure.
- "Economical" is changed to "economic" for accuracy.

- "The president" is changed to ", President" to improve sentence structure.

- "Forgive" is changed to "pardon" for accuracy.

aligned: You can enjoy your time spending all {the=>your} money {you have , buying=>on} clothes , {jewells=>jewelry} , {furnitures=>furniture} , {etc . and=>etc. ;} you {could=>can} have a {real=>really} great time .

aligned: {The=>If the} door {it is broken=>breaks} , we can replace it {rapidly=>quickly ,} and it {is not=>wo n't be} expensive {when=>, since} it {is=>'s} plastic .

- "The" was changed to "if the" in order to present a hypothetical situation, which requires a conditional sentence (If the). The general form of this sentence begins with "if the" and takes the present tense form of the verb (breaks).
- "Is not" is replaced with "won't be." The conditional sentence requires the won't + infinitive verb form.
- "When" is replaced by "since" to correct a lexical error.
llm_explanation:

- The redundant pronoun "it" was removed to improve sentence fluency.
- "Rapidly" was changed to "quickly" to improve word choice.
- "Is not" was changed to "won't be" to improve sentence fluency and to show the negative aspect of the cost.
